meanings.definition: To become preserved in a fossil
meanings.sent1: Over time, the dinosaur bone fossilizes in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The ancient leaf fossilizes in the rock, showing us the past.
meanings.sent3: When the tree stump fossilizes, it becomes a stone memory of nature.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter fossilizes in my mind, a precious moment frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The petrified wood fossilizes, capturing the essence of ancient forests.

meanings.sent1: His beliefs fossilize over the years, never changing.
meanings.sent2: The old traditions fossilize, resisting any new ideas.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's routine fossilizes into a daily ritual of predictability.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness fossilizes her mind, closing it off to new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The concrete fossilizes into a solid mass, unyielding to any force.

meanings.sent1: The technology fossilizes quickly in today's fast-paced world.
meanings.sent2: Fashion trends fossilize faster than we can keep up.
meanings.sent3: His slang fossilizes into phrases only he understands.
meanings.sent4: The old library system fossilizes, unable to adapt to digital books.
meanings.sent5: Her music taste fossilizes in the '80s, never exploring new genres.
